result.execSummary:
The defendant Justin Hugh Finklea was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Justin Hugh Finklea is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Justin Hugh Finklea was found guilty of Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defndant to meet with payment clerk.

Defendant is eligible for expungement in 1 year if he does the following:
-No new arrests.
-Defendant to send proof  to the Court of completion of AODA.
-Defendant to send proof to the Court that he is working on completing his High School Diploma.
-Defendant must petition the Court for expungement.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Justin Hugh Finklea

defendant.name: Finklea, Justin Hugh
defendant.address: 17451 Kettle River Blvd, Forest Lake, MN 55025

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: From DE's mother requesting to make pymt over the phone.  Gave DE's mother the pymt options & verified pymt amt & due date. jaf
c: Def, Atty, DA & WSP. eif
DE appeared.  DE to pay $50/mo comm 5-18-15.  $15 Pplan Fee added.  DE signed Pplan Agmt. jaf
Defendant signed OFP at $50.00 per month commencing 5/18/15. eif
signed by Def & Atty this date. eif

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA: Michael E. Nieskes DF ATTY: Joseph R. Caton DF: Justin Hugh Finklea appeared. Case called at 4:07.  ADA Nieskes updates the court and to possible diversion agreement. Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads G to Ct 1 in 15CM80. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 1  in 15CM80. On motion of the State, Crt dismisses Ct 2 in15CM80. Sentencing arguments. Court questions DE. Crt orders: 
- Costs of $443
Court grants expungment in 1 year if DE does the following:
- No new arrests 
- DE sends Court proof of completion of AODA
- DE to send proof to the Court that he is working on completing HS diploma
DE will meet with the payment clerk.
Pre-trial conference on April 8, 2015 at 04:00 pm.

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA: Matthew L Hartung DF ATTY: Joseph R. Caton DF: Justin Hugh Finklea appeared. Case called at 11:43. Set for PTC. Atty. Caton updates the court. DE needs to schedule a compass. Court orders DE to make an appt. with Mr. O'Keefe to complete a compass. Bond continues.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 8, 2015 at 04:00 pm.
Pre-trial conference on March 16, 2015 at 11:30 am.

-Prior to leaving the courthouse, report to St Croix County Jail for mugshots and fingerprints.

-Zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician recongnized in Wisconsin) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

CO: SRN, RPR: Vicki Kasten, CLERK: E. Ferrill, Schulyer Boggio & ADA:  Matthew L Hartung,  DF ATTY:  Joseph R. Caton,  DF:  Justin Hugh Finklea appeared. Court confirms address.   Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading.  NG.  Waives speedy trial.   State to provide discovery within 20 days and motions within 10 days upon receipt of discovery. Court orders face to face settlement conference before next hearing.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 16, 2015 at 11:30 am.
